history.content: I don't think it's too hard to self-study, but you have to be disciplined. EE 126 is a math class, and you can't learn math by just watching lectures, you have to practice solving lots and lots of problems. This means the HWs, discussions, labs, past exams, etc. I don't think EE126 any harder to self-study than any other class.

I've been in the class and was learning a lot until some forces outside of my control made this semester much harder mid-way than I had anticipated and am considering late dropping this course. I was told that of the three "ML" classes (126, 127, 189) eecs126 is the hardest to self-study. Let me know if this is common consensus. 

I would really hate having to late-drop the class but I literally might not pass given my current situation. I was wondering how much of a loss I would be at if I was to drop the class and try to learn the material on my own through reading the textbook, lecture notes, doing the discussions, and homeworks by myself in the summer. 

I also don't have a particularly strong math background -- only 16a, 16b, and 70. I know taking classes are ideal but would it be more of an invoncinence to self-learn, like it would be less efficient but the skills/knowledge would be the same as taking the class, or would I probably be at a significant detriment by not being in a classroom environment? 

Thanks
